attributes.action: Negotiate with the nursing unions, including pay.
attributes.additional_details: The government can prevent more strikes by discussing all of the issues of disagreement, including pay. The nursing unions have repeatedly requested negotiations, the government should respond positively. The government’s refusal to enter into meaningful discussions is harming patients and exacerbating the crisis in NHS.
attributes.background: As our representatives MPs are duty bound to act in accordance with the wishes of their constituents. The refusal by government to discuss pay with the nursing unions does not reflecting what the public want or expect. Open negotiations now.

rejection.details:
Since you started your petition the Government has met with nursing trading unions to discuss pay.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Ensure All National Health Staff receive a minimum 7.5% pay increase: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/630102

Give doctors and nurses the 20% pay rise they deserve: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/630032
